title: Critical Mass Bike Ride at Market Square Park
address: 301 Milam St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Bike through Downtown Houston during this monthly community ride with Critical Mass. This event happens every last Friday of the month. All bikers welcome. Admission: Free.

title: Texas Ink & Art Expo in Galveston
address: 5600 Seawall Blvd Houston , TX 77554 United States
body: Ink lovers unite at this 3-day Tattoo Expo that will include live tattooing, tattoo art, contests, and even a freak show at the Galveston Island Convention Center. Admission Tickets are $20 per day or $35 for a 3-day pass.

title: Romp Around with Romper Rye at Holler Brewing Co.
address: 2206 Edwards St Houston , TX 77007 United States
body: Wear your favorite stylish romper as summer comes to an end and enjoy $4 pints of the Romper Rye all night long at Holler Brewing Co. There will also be a romper fashion show and someone will be named romper King and Queen. Admission: Free.

title: Pinot for the People at Pappas Bros
address: 1200 McKinney St. Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Beginning at 5:30 p.m., Pappas Bros. Steakhouse Houston Downtown, 1200 McKinney, will be celebrating the rapid growth in popularity (and quality) of Pinot Noir. For $75 plus tax and gratuity, guests can join Pappas sommeliers as they showcase the best Pinot Noirs being made today, with selections ranging from the classic Pinot Noir regions of Burgundy and Sonoma to a few under-the-radar producers. A chef selection of seasonal hors d’oeuvres will be available as well.

title: Artist Talk with Lan Duong at Blaffer Art Museum
address: 4173 Elgin Street Houston, TX 77004 United States
body: Presented in conjunction with the exhibition by The Propeller Group, enjoy a talk by Lan Duong about Vietnamese film followed by a conversation with Duy Lap Nguyen at Blaffer Art Museum. Admission: Free.

title: Karbachtoberfest at Karbach Brewing Co.
address: 2032 Karbach St Houston, TX 77092 United States
body: Celebrate Karbachtoberfest with four weekends of festivities, a German inspired menu, beer, live performances and more. Admission: No Cover.

title: Hell Or High Water Night Market at East End Street Market
address: 2800 Navigation Blvd Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: East End Street Market presents their monthly night market featuring local music, artisan small business vendors, food and complimentary adult beverages. Admission: No cover.

title: Alison Wonderland at House of Blues
address: 1204 Caroline Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Australian EDM artist Alison Wonderland will bring her infectious jams over to House of Blues. One listen to 2015's Run should convince you to catch her live; she drops tunes that could make anyone want to get down. The pop-infused electronica of Elohim will open the all-ages show. Admission: 20$.

title: Circo Avenida at Discovery Green
address: 1500 Mckinney St Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Witness a family-friendly circus-like event with acrobats, contortionists and more at Discovery Green park. Admission: Free.

title: Love Yo’Self: A Showcase at Avant Garden
address: 411 Westheimer Rd Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Head to Avant Garden in Montrose to check out local musicians and DJs perform at this showcase. Proceeds from this event will contribute to Hurricane Harvey relief efforts. Admission Tickets are $10.

title: Tiki Night at South Bank Seafood Bar
address: 702 W. Dallas Houston , TX 77019 United States
body: The South Bank Seafood Bar hosts a Tiki-themed party on their patio with a pig roasting, festive apparel, and a tiki cocktail menu. Admission: No cover.

title: Oktoberfest at Henke & Pillot
address: 809 Congress Avenue Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Celebrate Oktoberfest at Henke & Pillot with specials on drinks and food, German house and club music, and plenty of German beer on draft. Admission No cover.

title: Umbria at The Sugarland Auditorium
address: 226 Lakeview Dr. Sugar Land, TX 77478 United States
body: Umbria in Sugar Land will be a multi-day Italian film festival throughout the city featuring Italian films from the Festival del Cinema Città di Spello ed i Borghi Umbri. The event will also include regional food, wine, and crafts from Umbria. Admission: $10.

title: Float & Flick Summer Movie Series at Hotel Derek
address: 2525 West Loop S Houston, TX 77027 United States
body: Watch Mean Girls on a 3 story movie wall while sitting poolside and enjoying food and drinks from the Revolve Kitchen + Bar at Hotel Derek. Admission: 20$.

title: Date Night Cooking Class Series at Brennan’s of Houston
address: 3300 Smith St. Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Learn to cook a timeless 3-course meal for two with your sweetie at this Date Night Cooking Class at Brennan's of Houston this summer.  Admission: $150 per person.

title: Galveston Island Shrimp Festival
address: Galveston Island, Galveston, TX 77554 United States
body: Get a taste of the island at this local shrimp festival, which features special highlights like Friday’s VIP kick-off party, Saturday’s Gumbo Stroll, the Lil’ Shrimp’s Parade, and an official 5k beginning at 9am on Saturday morning. Admission Tickets start at $10.

title: Keep it Brassy at Music Box Theatre
address: 2623 Colquitt Houston, TX 77098 United States
body: The Music Box Theater's boisterous vocal ensemble performs hits from across the realms of Motown, funk, Broadway and big band. Keep it Brassy is a powerhouse musical experience peppered with plenty of laughs, and fueled by horn-filled grooves from house band G Sharp and the MBT 3. Admission: Tickets start at $29.

title: 4th Wall Theatre Co. presents Disgraced at Studio 101
address: 1824 Spring Street Houston, TX 77007 United States
body: In Disgraced, idle dinner party chit-chat explodes into the kind of rollicking, no-holds-barred argument that makes for truly delicious theater. Winner of a Pulitzer Prize, and also a Tony nominee for Best Play. Admission $32

title: Harvey at A.D. Players Theater
address: 2710 W. Alabama Houston, TX 77098 United States
body: Playwright Mary Chase won a Pulitzer Prize for Harvey, her classic comedy about a mild-mannered middle-aged man named Elwood, his domineering, social-climber sister Veta, and Elwood's best friend (a giant invisible rabbit named Harvey). 20$ Admission

title: Sing Movie Screening at Miller Outdoor Theatre
address: 6000 Hermann Park Drive Houston, TX 77030 United States
body: Watch the animated movie about a koala who stages a singing competition in order to save his theater, Sing, at Miller Outdoor Theatre. Admission: Free.

title: Enemies at Main Street Theater
address: 540 Times Boulevard Houston, TX 7005 United States
body: Main Street Theater stages an original production of Gorky's extraordinary play, which was written in exile and banned in his home country. The play presents a panoramic view of a restless society. It’s 1905, and Russia is at a critical moment in its history. Admission $42

title: Marco Antonio Solis in Concert at Toyota Center
address: 1510 Polk St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: The iconic Mexican singer Marco Antonio Solis hits the stage with openers Jesse & Joy at Toyota Center. Admission Tickets start at $59.50.

title: The Mystery of Edwin Drood Musical at Obsidian Theater
address: 3522 White Oak Drive Houston, TX 77007 United States
body: The winner of five Tony Awards when it played on Broadway, The Mystery of Edwin Drood is a riotous, interactive whodunit mystery musical that invites the audience to enter the action and play detective. Admission: Tickets start at $37.50.

title: Wonder Woman Movie Screening at Memorial City
address: 303 Memorial City Way Houston, TX 77024 United States
body: Enjoy an outdoor screening of the 2017 live action movie, Wonder Woman, on The Square at Memorial City Mall. Admission: Free.

title: Rich Williams’ Joke Riot Comedy Show at The Secret Group
address: 2101 Polk Street Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: Stand up comedian RIch Williams hosts his monthly Joke Riot Comedy Show that features performers seen on NBC, FOX, Comedy Central, Nickelodeon, and BET at The Secret Group. Admission Tickets start at $20 and are $40 for VIP.

title: Miears & Mark Drew in Concert at 8th Wonder Brewery
address: 2202 Dallas St Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: Electro-pop musician and singer Miears performs with special guest, rapper Mark Drew at 8th Wonder Brewery. Admission No cover.

title: The Flaming Lips in Concert at Revention Music Center
address: 520 Texas St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Get ready for confetti as the wildly entertaining rock band, The Flaming Lips hit the stage at Revention Music Center with opener Mac DeMarco. Admission Tickets start at $40.

title: Paramore in Concert at Smart Financial Centre
address: 18111 Lexington Boulevard Sugar Land, TX 77479 United States
body: Pop punk band Paramore makes their way to town for their Tour Two dates with special guests Best Coast at the Smart Financial Centre at Sugar Land. Admission Tickets range from $38.50 to $65.

title: Describe the Night at the University of Houston Quintero Theatre
address: 4116 Elgin Houston, TX 77004 United States
body: Check out the world premiere of Describe the Night, a play that tells the story of men and women, spies, conspiracy theories, and the ever onward passage of time. Admission Tickets are $65.

title: Sassy Mamas at the Ensemble Theatre
address: 3535 Main St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Sassy Mamas is a romantic comedy that centers on three women of substance and achievement in confident pursuit of younger men. Catch the regional premiere of this entertaining romantic comedy from NAACP Image Award winner Celeste Bedford Walker at The Ensemble Theatre. Admission Tickets range between $42 to $61.

title: Shakin’ All Over: ’60s Dance Party at Big Top Lounge
address: 3714 Main Street Houston , TX 77002 United States
body: Shoeshine Charley's Big Top Lounge on Mid Main hosts a night of '60s surf, garage, soul, drinks, and dancing. Admission Cover charge at the door.

title: Classic Numbers at Numbers
address: 300 Westheimer Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Houston's Longest running weekly event and the best FRIDAY NIGHT Party in town! Music & video from the 80's w/ current Classic Numbers music mixed by Dj wES wALLACE! 1.50 Well Drinks, 1.75 Domestic Beer & $2.00 Coronas till 11:00. WE PLAY VINYL - AND Videos!! Doors @ 9:00PM

title: Flaming Lips After Party at Satellite Bar
address: 6922 Harrisburg Blvd Houston, TX 77011 United States
body: Brothers Griiin, the drum duo who plays with The Flaming Lips, DJ at this after party at Satellite Bar in the East End. Admission Tickets are $8.50 in advance if you call (713) 425-6669 and $10 at the door.
